results.title: Serena Williams Returns to the U.S. Open Final
results.abstract: Williams beat Anastasija Sevastova, 6-3, 6-0, in the semifinals and will have another chance to tie Margaret Court’s record of 24 major singles titles.

multimedia.caption: Serena Williams, a six-time U.S. Open champion, advanced to the final in New York for the ninth time.
multimedia.copyright: Ben Solomon for The New York Times

results.title: The N.F.L. Struggles to Tackle Its Latest Problem: Tackling
results.abstract: A new rule designed to make the game safer by minimizing using the helmet as a weapon during tackles has left everybody scratching their … head.

multimedia.caption: The N.F.L. is trying to limit helmet-to-helmet contact by penalizing players who lead with their head.
The N.F.L. is trying to limit helmet-to-helmet contact by penalizing players who lead with their head.

results.title: Tiger Woods Goes to His Car for Help at the BMW Championship
results.abstract: Erratic putting and weak first rounds have stymied his comeback, but he went to an old putter and shot an eight-under 62 to share the lead with Rory McIlroy.

multimedia.caption: Tiger Woods’s 62 on Thursday was the lowest score of his comeback season.

results.title: Kaepernick’s Knee and Olympic Fists Are Linked by History
results.abstract: Why Colin Kaepernick is the heir to a sports protest movement popularized by two athletes at the 1968 Olympics who raised their fists to support civil rights.

multimedia.caption: The gesture by the athletes Tommie Smith, center, and John Carlos at the 1968 Olympics was ultimately widely seen as a landmark in the civil rights movement.
The gesture by the athletes Tommie Smith, center, and John Carlos at the 1968 Olympics was ultimately widely seen as a landmark in the civil rights movement.

results.title: It’s the Wettest U.S. Open, Even Without Much Rain
results.abstract: Hot and humid conditions have made it uncomfortable for players throughout the tournament, and they are calling for changes at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

multimedia.caption: The 2018 U.S. Open has been hot and humid since it began on Aug. 27. Seven of 11 days, including Thursday, were played under special rules for extreme heat.
multimedia.copyright: Karsten Moran for The New York Times

results.title: The W.N.B.A. Finals: When Her Game is Your Game, Too
results.abstract: The Storm and the Mystics have matching M.V.P.s — Breanna Stewart and Elena Delle Donne — and similar game plans. How do you outsmart yourself?

multimedia.caption: Seattle Storm guard Sue Bird, left, has captivated basketball fans in these playoffs, but the battle between Breanna Stewart, right, and Elena Delle Donne of the Washington Mystics could decide which team wins the W.N.B.A. championship.

results.title: N.F.L. Week 1 Picks: Can the Texans Keep Up With New England?
results.abstract: Tom Brady and the Patriots taking on Houston’s Deshaun Watson; a clash of the last two N.F.C. champions; Aaron Rodgers in prime time. Week 1 has a lot to offer.

multimedia.caption: Deshaun Watson had Houston clicking before a season-ending injury last year. Can he pick up where he left off?

results.title: Rafael Nadal Plays the Classics. Will He Be Ready for Another?
results.abstract: The chances of another epic match are good when Nadal and Juan Martín del Potro lock forehands in the U.S. Open semifinals on Friday.

multimedia.caption: Rafael Nadal has been involved in three of the best men’s tennis matches of the year. Will his semifinal against Juan Martín del Potro be another?

results.title: Gary Sanchez’s Woes Behind the Plate Continue in a Painful Yankees Loss
results.abstract: Sanchez allowed two passed balls in the first inning as the Yankees allowed the Athletics to move to within three and a half games of the top A.L. wild-card spot.

multimedia.caption: Gary Sanchez, right, and Luis Severino had a talk on the mound during a disastrous first inning on Wednesday.

results.title: The Shohei Ohtani Hype Was Real, and So Were the Injury Fears
results.abstract: Ohtani is headed for Tommy John surgery, clouding his future as a two-way star in the major leagues.

results.title: With Trinidad Haunting and Brazil Looming, U.S. Soccer Is Still Searching for a Coach
results.abstract: It has been nearly a year since the United States failed to qualify for the 2018 World Cup, and the national team still doesn’t have a permanent coach.
org_facet: United States Men's National Soccer Team

multimedia.caption: The U.S. national team’s general manager, Earnie Stewart, said he will take his time finding a new coach.

results.title: Steelers’ Le’Veon Bell Turmoil Gives Bettors a Reason to Like the Browns
results.abstract: The movement of the betting line indicates that a lot of people are wagering on the Browns, who were 0-16 last season, as the Pittsburgh running back continues to hold out.

results.abstract: The already-good Rams got even better, the Bay Area is feeling Garoppolo Fever, and the Seahawks search for a new identity.

results.title: College or Pro? It’s a Tough Call When You’re 12
results.abstract: Olivia Moultrie and her family are challenging long-held assumptions about the best way to develop an American women’s soccer star. U.S. Soccer and the University of North Carolina are among those watching closely.

results.title: Richard M. DeVos, Amway Co-Founder and G.O.P. Stalwart, Dies at 92
results.abstract: Mr. DeVos turned the marketing company into a global enterprise and used his wealth to strengthen the Republican Party and buy the Orlando Magic basketball team.

multimedia.caption: Richard M. DeVos in 2007. He turned the privately owned Amway Corporation into a global enterprise with more than $8.6 billion in sales in 2017.

results.abstract: Wheeler was struck by a liner from Justin Turner in the fourth inning, but he stayed in the game and improved to 10-7 on the year.

results.abstract: Before he became sneaker famous, the retired tennis player won two Grand Slam championships and was ranked No. 1 in the world.

results.title: Embracing the Moment, Madison Keys Is Back in the U.S. Open Semifinals
results.abstract: Keys is the only one of last year’s all-American women’s semifinalists to book a return trip. On the men’s side, Novak Djokovic slogged through a three-set win over John Millman.

multimedia.caption: Madison Keys reached the semifinals of the U.S. Open for the second consecutive year.

results.title: Naomi Osaka and Kei Nishikori Both Reach U.S. Open Semifinals, a First for Japan
results.abstract: Both won on Wednesday to make history for their country, giving it two players in the semifinals of a Grand Slam for the first time.

multimedia.caption: Naomi Osaka, who moved to the United States from Japan when she was 3, needed just 57 minutes to defeat Lesia Tsurenko of Ukraine.
